result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

2:03 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Trent Michael Brinker. Defendant Trent Michael Brinker in court, in custody, Agent Volz appeared by video means. INCLUDES 22CF105, 22CF287 and 22CF382. Kait B., Treatment Court Coordinator states DE is eligible for treatment court, DE can be assessed as to acceptance or denial, COMPAS has been completed. OFF RECORD - Counsel to submit restitution request within 30 days. 

Court orders:
22CF105
Ct 1 - Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
S/W 4 years probation with conditions:
- 60 days conditional jail time - Huber granted
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Complete treatment court application process; if accepted, DE to successfully complete treatment court
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections 
- No contact with Renu P., Derek L., Alyssa S.M., Game Unlimited Hunting Club, Wingin' It Bar & Grill, Tac Bell in New Richmond, WI, D's Auto, Todd H., Red Cedar Automotive, Peter M., Taylor S., Logan R.
- Restitution - TBD
- Court Costs $268; payable through DOC
- DNA Sample & Surcharge $250; payable through DOC

22CF287
Ct 2 - Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
S/W 4 years probation with conditions:
- 60 days conditional jail time - Huber granted
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Complete treatment court application process; if accepted, DE to successfully complete treatment court
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections 
- No contact with Renu P., Derek L., Alyssa S.M., Game Unlimited Hunting Club, Wingin' It Bar & Grill, Tac Bell in New Richmond, WI, D's Auto, Todd H., Red Cedar Automotive, Peter M., Taylor S., Logan R.
- Restitution - TBD
- Court Costs $268; payable through DOC
- DNA Sample & Surcharge $250; payable through DOC

22CF382
Ct 1 - Burglary - Building or Dwelling
S/W 4 years probation with conditions:
- 60 days conditional jail time - Huber granted
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Complete treatment court application process; if accepted, DE to successfully complete treatment court
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections 
- No contact with Renu P., Derek L., Alyssa S.M., Game Unlimited Hunting Club, Wingin' It Bar & Grill, Tac Bell in New Richmond, WI, D's Auto, Todd H., Red Cedar Automotive, Peter M., Taylor S., Logan R.
- Court Costs $268; payable through DOC
- DNA Sample & Surcharge $250; payable through DOC

If DE is admitted into treatment court sooner, Court will consider staying conditional time.
22CF105: 0 days jail credit.
22CF287: 173 days jail credit in the event of revocation
22CF382: 146 days jail credit in the event of revocation

Adjourned. kma

8:32 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Defendant Trent Michael Brinker in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Trent Michael Brinker.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Agent N. Volz appears. Includes 22CF382, 22CF287 and 22CF105. No changes to the PSI. Sentence recommendations. Recess - Case recalled at 9:05 am. Court resets SEH to later today, 11/1/22 at 2:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

8:31 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Defendant Trent Michael Brinker in court, in custody.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Trent Michael Brinker. Includes 22CF105, 22CF287 and 22CF382. There is an agreement. Court reads charges and maximum penalties. DE pleads NO CONTEST to 22CF105, count 1 - Take and Drive w/o consent; 22CF287, Count 2 - Take and Drive w/o Consent 2nd; and 22CF382, Count 1 - Burglary AMENDED WITHOUT REPEATER. DE sworn. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of 22CF105, count 1 - Take and Drive w/o consent; 22CF287, Ct 2 - Take and Drive w/o Consent 2nd; and 22CF382, Ct 1 - Burglary AMENDED TO WITHOUT REPEATER. On motion of the State without objection, Court READS IN and DISMISSES 22CF287 Counts 1, 3, 4, 5 and 6 and also 22CF382 Counts 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10.  PSI is discussed. Atty Satorius argues PSI and gives sentence recommendations. Court orders a PSI. PSI to be produced by 10/21/22. Bail is revoked and def is remanded.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

There is an agreement that includes a global resolution with cases 22CF105 - count 1, 22CF287 - count 2 and 22CF382 - count 1. Atty Ballo recites agreement. Court to review cases before sentencing and resets.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,      Game Unlimited, Peter Melloy and Wing It Bar & Grill.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
Preliminary hearing on June 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Game Unlimited, Peter Melloy, and Wing It Bar & Grill.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
